review:
He is an awesome Paediatrician. Been treating my 11 month baby since the day he was born. He has given me superb advice on BF and guidance on how to resume work. I was able to join back at 5.5 months and my kid has been doing so well under his care. Not too many sick days even though I take my kid to office daycare. He only gives bare minimum medicines required when sick, really like his style and medicating philosophy.
I would recommend him to all new mothers - his advice is so much more practical and useful than anything you would read online.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Explanation of the health issue,Treatment satisfaction,Value for money,Wait time,
review:
He was my peadiatrician when he was practicing  in ST JOHN HOSPITAL HE WAS KNOWING MY OP NUMBER AND WHENEVER I WAS SICK HE HAS TREATED US AND NOW MY DAUGHTER OF 5 YEARS OLD AND MY SON 5 MONTHS OLD GETTING TREATED 

ABOUT ONE LADY COMPLAINING OF TAKING CARE BY DOCTOR. PLEASE DONT FEEL BAD HE IS TELLING US TO THINK PRIORITY OF OUR YOUNG KIDS FIRST IN THAT AGE IF DOCTOR IF HE SAYS THAT THINK HOW MUCH CARE HE IS GUIDING US TO TAKE CARE RATHER THAN BLAMING.

I am a little late to give this review...I took my 4 month old baby to Manipal when he was down with a cold 2 years back. This is what Dr.Subha said when I told the him that I planned to start work in a three months. He asked me why would you...your child needs you..atleast till he is 3....he asked me if I pray to god....what did I pray for when I was pregnant...for a healthy baby...and that me going back to work will compromise his health.....do u need to go to work....I said I do....I need to support my family and take care of my parents....he said u don't really need to....u need to prioritize your child...if u don't, then he will fall sick from time to time...You can go to work...God is great, he will take care of your child anyway.....

I ended up crying in front of him(as I was already anxious about my sick child and had visited the hospital without my husband accompanying me...had to do first time registration with a crying baby in my hands).

I understand that he must be fed up of working parents bringing in their sick children to the hospital and asking for advice. So he must have got angry or frustrated.
But you have to keep in mind that we cannot afford a hospital like Manipal on a single income. If he meant what he said, he should practice at a place that doesn't charge so much.

My daughter had a severe abdominal pain and high fever this doctor did a urine test and diagnosed as viral fever but the same day when the fever touched 103 i rushed to another hospital *** **** ***** **** **  *** ***** **** ********

*** ***** *** ** ******* **** **** * *** ** ********* He was my pediatrician when I was a kid and now he is my daughter's pediatrician. He has seen the world change and he has experience that cannot be weighed. ** ** ** *** *** **** ************ ** *** ****** ******* * ***** ***.
Heart warming welcome for the child. The child feels good to be around the doctor. Remembers the child every time and doesn't have to make N introduction every time.

tags: Doctor friendliness,Treatment satisfaction,Explanation of the health issue,Value for money,
review: I recommend the doctor,awesome doctor for kids.100%treatment satisfaction,he is very friendly to kids.
very experienced . Does not give strong dosages and antibiotics generally is what we noriced. Medicines and food moderation adviced gives right result

review:
Went to consult the doctor for my 8 months old baby who was suffering from severe cold and cough... doctor prescribed ATARAX and livolin .*** *** ****** **** ** *** **** ** ******* *** **** ** ***** ******* ****** **** ***** *** * *** **** *** **** ****** ***** ****** **** ****** *******
Not sure whom to trust .
